intro: Simaba guianensis var. ecaudata, commonly known as the Guianan simaba, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive foliage and floral structure. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a glossy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, producing a fragrant aroma that attracts pollinators.
